thread.title: MLB to review Rogers Centre's security following disturbance
thread.title_full: MLB to review Rogers Centre's security following disturbance - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: MLB to review Rogers Centre's security following disturbance
text:
Photo: Nathan Denette, AP Image 1 of / 3   3 Toronto Blue Jays players celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays clinched their first trip to the American League Championship Series since 1993, overcoming one of the most bizarre plays in playoff history by taking advantage of three Rangers errors for a 6-3 victory. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Toronto Blue Jays players celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays clinched their ... more Photo: Nathan Denette, AP Image 2 of 3 Toronto Blue Jays Marco Estrada, center, celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays clinched their first trip to the American League Championship Series since 1993, overcoming one of the most bizarre plays in playoff history by taking advantage of three Rangers errors for a 6-3 victory. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Toronto Blue Jays Marco Estrada, center, celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays ... more Photo: Nathan Denette, AP Image 3 of 3 Toronto Blue Jays players celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays clinched their first trip to the American League Championship Series since 1993, overcoming one of the most bizarre plays in playoff history by taking advantage of three Rangers errors for a 6-3 victory. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Toronto Blue Jays players celebrate with fans after winning Game 5 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays clinched their ... more Photo: Nathan Denette, AP MLB to review Rogers Centre's security following disturbance 1  /  3 Back to Gallery NEW YORK (AP) — Major League Baseball will review security at Toronto's Rogers Centre in an effort to prevent a repeat of the fan disturbance during Game 5 of the Blue Jays ' AL Division Series win over Texas.
Spectators littered the field with debris during an 18-minute delay Wednesday. Toronto catcher Russell Martin hit Texas batter Shin-Soo Choo with his seemingly simple return throw to the pitcher, which resulted in a go-ahead run for the Rangers after several conferences and an umpire's review. Toronto scored four runs in the bottom of the inning and went on to win 6-3.
"The highly unfortunate reactions of a group of fans at Rogers Centre in Wednesday's game represented a major source of concern," MLB said in a statement Thursday. "We appreciate the response of the local authorities and the Blue Jays stadium operations staff in identifying, ejecting and — in some cases — arresting the offenders."
Toronto opens the AL Championship Series at Kansas City on Friday and hosts the Royals for Games 3-5 starting Monday.
"We will discuss comprehensive security plans for upcoming postseason games in Toronto and reiterate the importance of fans observing the appropriate code of conduct," MLB said. "Setting yesterday's situation aside, the enthusiasm from Toronto fans in recent months has been extraordinary. We will do everything we can to foster a safe and fan-friendly atmosphere at Rogers Centre and to ensure that a situation like Wednesday's will not be repeated."
